comments.commentBody: Somebody was asking how to help. One way to help is through the organization Oxfam America. I donate regularly to them, and they have  already started a campaign to get funds to help Haiti. You can Google the name because I don't know the exact website address.

Our prayers are with the poor and suffering in Haiti tonight.  The few photos of the natural disaster illustrate the devastation wrought upon these proud and determined people.  May God bring solace and comfort to the souls of the island.  Now, every citizen of the USA should challenge himself to ask:  "How can help!"

Why are you waiting, mobilize everything now, more than you think you need. You can always return. They need help now. Motivate.
I believe the haitians deforested the country for cooking fuel. I recommend massive donations of cheap solar stoves and stills.
Nice, Nancy # 24. Watch out for Number One. That's the American, humanitarian way. Me first. I me me mine. Lovely. Be proud.

Bottom line:
Close www.google.cn.
Keep www.google.com
Net effect on Google Inc? Positive PR outside of China. Little or no loss of revenue inside of China.

From what I saw during the quake up until it got dark, its bad, real bad!  It was like being in the movie EARTHQUAKE.  Vehicles being tossed around, dust, smoke, buildings falling, people running, screaming and wailing, looking for their children at the schools. Port au Prince is going to require a lot of assistance to recover from this!
I hope the Google takes the same stance against the Australian Government's proposed actions to impose internet censorship in Australia,by way of a mandatory "filter."

It's heartening to read all the messages and prayers for the people of Haiti; those people have suffered so much and have so little that anything anyone can do is so important.  They don't have the equipment for rescue and recovery much less rebuilding.  And to all those who can't find it in their tiny, twisted little hearts to lend a hand to those of God's children who need help, remember back to 9/11.  Countries all over the world, including mine, took stranded Americans in.  After Katrina, international agencies had a faster response than the American government.  NOBODY asked for a penny in payment.
So its all about money...c'mon Google, change the game !

Wow. I'm impressed. To the good people at google:

Keep on trying and never stop. I see what you are doing and so do a lot of us. Being an internet company, you know how hard it is for anyone (especially a hippie like myself) to say something nice on the internet or about a company... but 'keep up the good work'. I can't imagine your next share-holder meeting is going to be fun but those people and the commenters on this message boards are justifiably suspicious of a company that appears to be trying to make a positive difference.

"There must be an evil motive in uncensoring your Chinese search results," they'll argue but even I'll admit that I can't guess one.

"You could have done this four years ago," they'll say, although the punishment to the Chinese government of losing a multi-billion dollar company that is employing a lot of its (innocent) citizens is far more palpable than the loss of a company that was never there.

"The Chinese government won't care anyway," they'll say, seemingly blaming you for not controlling the world. This one I just don't get.

But you've heard it before because I did too. "My email may be free and limitless and I may have free online organizational and office software for my small business but you then get access to all that data I gave you and you must be using it for evil." Wait... I'm the one who said that. And I still wonder. But, as the Chinese government probably knows, I created my gmail account 5 years ago and you haven't given me many reasons to pause. (OK, the FISA thing hurt... but even Superman loses a fight every once in a while. You did fight, right?)

So, keep up the good work. It's pretty inspiring.

- D.
